description: Sven Halek, citing the need for stability, authorizes a staged tribunal on the BCI’s fate. He drafts internal protocols to screen participants using BCI scores and ensures all public messaging frames the event as open and historic.

The Council launches a highly publicized tribunal, claiming to include voices from across society. In practice, only citizens with high BCI scores are allowed to meaningfully participate, while dissenters are quietly excluded.
Journalist Rada investigates and exposes how tribunal access was manipulated by live score adjustments, sparking outrage among citizens and mid-level system staff.

Engineers and mid-level staff, angered by exposed deceit, stage walkouts and refuse BCI maintenance duties. Key city services suffer as a result. Council orders a broadcast blackout in an attempt to contain the unrest.
Large-scale demonstrations erupt as both citizens and public employees openly defy Council control. The staged tribunal collapses, provoking a major legitimacy crisis for Stenograd’s governance.
